page.title: 11GREAT PARK OLD WINDSOR
page.content: Part of the 400 acres of Windsor Great Park lies in the block;it is an area of open grassland, woodland and farms originally part of the Great Royal Hunting Forest owned by the Crown and most is open to the public;picnicing, jogging,fishing,horse riding (with a permit),are some of the activities here.Charitable organisations hold functions here and a model aircraft flying club with 150 members uses the area. The first Domesday Book mentions Old Windsor as the 2nd largest village in Berkshire;William the Conqueror directed the building of Windsor Castle from here.The A308 bisects the land area;80 new houses were built in Saxon Close in 1985.The annual village carnival reflects the strong community spirit.The carnival theme for 1985 was "Trades and Professions".
